planet_star_radius_ratio.reasoning: Ratio of planet to star size. True planets have specific size ratios; large ratios may indicate stellar companion

planet_density_proxy.reasoning: Density proxy. Rocky planets have higher density than gas giants; helps distinguish planet types

insol_teq_ratio.reasoning: Stefan-Boltzmann relationship. Inconsistencies may indicate false positives

orbital_velocity.reasoning: Orbital velocity. Unusually high values may indicate unstable orbits or measurement errors

hill_sphere_approx.reasoning: Hill sphere approximation. Indicates orbital stability region

periapsis_distance.reasoning: Closest approach to star. Affects temperature and tidal forces

apoapsis_distance.reasoning: Farthest distance from star. Extreme orbits may indicate false positives

depth_consistency.reasoning: Transit depth should equal (Rp/Rs)^2. Large deviations indicate problems

duration_impact_relation.reasoning: Duration depends on impact parameter. Helps identify grazing transits

transit_snr.reasoning: SNR improves with sqrt(N) transits. Higher SNR = more confident detection

stellar_density.reasoning: Stellar density from surface gravity. Helps identify stellar type

main_sequence_deviation.reasoning: Deviation from main sequence. Large deviations may indicate evolved stars

metallicity_temp.reasoning: Metal-rich stars (high metallicity) more likely to have planets

g_r_color.reasoning: g-r color index. Indicates star temperature/type

r_i_color.reasoning: r-i color index. Another temperature indicator

j_k_color.reasoning: J-K color. Less affected by extinction than optical colors

is_multiplanet_system.reasoning: Multi-planet systems more likely to be real (planets rarely come alone)

total_fp_flags.formula: sum of all false positive flags
total_fp_flags.reasoning: More FP flags = higher chance of being false positive

snr_per_transit.reasoning: SNR normalized by number of transits. Indicates signal strength
